intro: Dillenia pedunculata, commonly known as the giant dillenia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers with five or six petals, which are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruits are woody, berry-like structures that contain several seeds. Dillenia pedunculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
